content.description: Zaab ( Delicious) Slab is the obvious black faced slab on the west face or the face you can see from the road. This problem starts standing in the middle and works directly up and then cuts out left at the small bulge up top.

The Farang ( Westerner) Arete is a cool problem and worth checking out its really committing on the upper section ( crux) be sure to have spotters and pads. The landing is alright just slightly angled downhill. Starts in the center of the face slightly left of the arete proper. Work up one or two moves on small crimps and then traverse right onto the arete. You will find reachy but good seams pulling the bulge on the arete and transitioning onto the arete are the cruxes until the top.
content.location: southwest arete or right arete when viewed from road

content.description: Chai-Yoh Crack is a cool fist crack that splits the back (southeast) arete. Jams lead to barndooring to a fun mantle. A good warm up for the area and cool feature.
content.location: southeast arete on boulder look for obvious crack feature

content.description: The Thailand boulder is a massive boulder that sits ontop of the cliff line. It can be identified by the road and where you park. It is a quick easy hike to get to it. Huge slab problems and highball test pieces exist on this boulder. Problems are developed on all sides except the highball overhung northface. Beautiful boulder and a must stop if your in the area.
